==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* Mamaloaco comes from ''Ilhuicatl-Mamaloaco'' ({{w|Nahuatl}}: “the sky where it is pierced or perforated”; Ilhuicatl “sky”; mamaloa “to perforate”; -co “where”), which was the fifth celestial stratum of the {{w|Thirteen Heavens}} of the {{w|Aztec Mythology}}. It is the palace where only comets and wandering stars move and is ruled by the celestial couple of {{w|Citlālicue}} and {{w|Citlalatonac}}.
